title: Toothpick-sucking US politician is furious that a ‘queer’ is running for president
text:
Tennessee police commissioner Warren Hurst made a vile rant against US presidential hopeful Pete Buttigieg because he is gay, and said he’d find better prospective leaders in his local jail (Pictures: CBS8)

A toothpick-sucking US politician was given a round of applause venting his anger about ‘a queer running for president.’

Warren Hurst, police commissioner for Server County in Tennessee, hit out at Democratic Presidential hopeful Pete Buttigieg, who is gay, during a meeting about gun control.

Speaking at the October 21 meeting, Hurst, whose face appeared to be pink with fury, said: ‘We got a queer running for president, if that ain’t about as ugly as you can get.

‘Look what we got running for president in the Democratic party.

‘We can go over here to Hoss’s jail and get better people out of there than those running for democratic to be President of the United States.’

Shockingly, Hurst’s rant was met with laughs and cheers from dozens of people attending the meeting, as well as his fellow politicians.

One woman was filmed storming out of the meeting in disgust by CBS8, with Servier County Mayor Perrin Anderson among those condemning Hurst’s comments.

Anderson said: ‘The statements made by Commissioner Hurst at the Sevier County Commission meeting of October 21, 2019, do not reflect the opinion or position of Sevier County administration,

‘Sevier County is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or status in any other group protected by law.’

Hurst spoke out amid plans to turn Servier County into a gun sanctuary city. That means no public cash would be spent on enforcing gun control measures deemed to violate the Second Amendment, which defends the right to bear arms.

Hurst’s comments appeared to be attacking Democratic presidential hopeful Pete Buttigieg, who is gay (Picture: Getty)

Hurst went on to rail against what he claimed was the erosion of rights for white men, saying: ‘I’m not prejudiced, a white male in this country has very few rights and they’re getting took more every day.’

After the meeting, Hurst told CBS8 that he wasn’t racist, because some of his best friends are black.

He added that he stood by his comments and that he’s entitled to his opinion.
description: Warren Hurst laid into US presidential hopeful Pete Buttigieg for being gay - then went on to claim that white men's rights are being eroded
